citation.article-title: Phylogeny of Photorhabdus and Xenorhabdus based on universally conserved protein-coding sequences and implications for the taxonomy of these two genera. Proposal of new taxa: X. vietnamensis sp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. caribbeanensis subsp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. hainanensis subsp. nov., P. temperata subsp. khanii subsp. nov., P. temperata subsp. tasmaniensis subsp. nov., and the reclassification of P. luminescens subsp. thracensis as P. temperata subsp. thracensis.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Photorhabdus temperata subsp. thracensis (Hazir et al. 2004) Tailliez, Laroui, Ginibre, Paule, Pagès and Boemare comb. nov.
Photorhabdus temperata subsp. thracensis (thra.cen′sis. L. fem. adj. thracensis referring to Thracia, Thrace, Western part of Turkey from where the type strain has been isolated).
Basonym: Photorhabdus luminescens subsp. thracensis Hazir et al. 2004.
Growth in LB broth is stopped by temperatures above 36–37 °C.
The type strain obtained from the Collection de l'Institut Pasteur is a phase II variant which does not produce light, in contrast to isolate FR32.
Positive for the Voges–Proskauer and Christensen's urease tests.
Assimilates cis-aconitate and does not produce acid from ribose.
Strain FR32 is also representative of this subspecies.
